It was the most lethal terrorist attack against American civilians until the September 11 attacks of 2001.

SUMMARY: A massive cross-country storm is producing damaging tornadoes in the South and punishing blizzard conditions in Colorado and the Plains that have resulted in shuttered interstates and snarled travel.

TITLE: Beijing streets left empty as Covid cases explode
SUMMARY: Empty streets, deserted shopping centers, and residents staying away from one another are the new normal in Beijing -- but not because the city, like many Chinese ones before it, is under a "zero-Covid" lockdown.

TITLE: US taxpayers' money benefited churches opposed to LGBTQI+ rights in Ghana
SUMMARY: An exclusive CNN investigation has found that some Western governments who pledged to support LGBTQI+ rights have also funded supporters of a controversial bill in Ghana that could introduce harsh sentences for advocating for sexual and gender minorities' rights.

TITLE: Covid cases explode in Beijing leaving city streets empty and daily life disrupted
SUMMARY: Empty streets, deserted shopping centers, and residents staying away from one another are the new normal in Beijing -- but not because the city, like many Chinese ones before it, is under a "zero-Covid" lockdown.

TITLE: Binance withdrawals jump to $3 billion in 24 hours, research firm says
SUMMARY: Investors withdrew as much as $3 billion from Binance on Tuesday, according to blockchain analytics firm Nansen, as the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange confronted investor jitters amid a deluge of negative headlines about the industry.

TITLE: 'It's just one of these things that had been likely brewing for years,' his wife, Dr. Celine Gounder, says
SUMMARY: Grant Wahl, the American soccer reporter who collapsed and died while covering the World Cup in Qatar last week, died of an aortic aneurysm that ruptured, his wife, Dr. Celine Gounder, said Wednesday.

TITLE: World Cup security guard dies after fall while on duty at the Lusail Stadium
SUMMARY: A Kenyan security guard who reportedly fell while on duty at Qatar's Lusail Stadium has died in hospital, his family and officials have confirmed to CNN.

TITLE: Messi confirms final will be last World Cup game ever
SUMMARY: Lionel Messi's lifelong dream of guiding Argentina to World Cup glory will remain alive until the last day of Qatar 2022, as La Albiceleste outclassed a weary-looking Croatia in a 3-0 victory in Tuesday's semifinal.

TITLE: Watch: Expert answers who the GOAT of soccer is
SUMMARY: "CNN This Morning" anchors Don Lemon, Poppy Harlow, Kaitlan Collins and The Athletic reporter Sam Stejskal weigh in on two of the most disputed questions among soccer fans: Who is better -- Cristiano Ronaldo or Lionel Messi? And who is the best player of all time?

TITLE: The most successful African team ever in the World Cup now faces the defending champs
SUMMARY: Morocco has experienced a World Cup fairytale like no other.

TITLE: Opinion: The Morocco-France game is so much bigger than football
SUMMARY: "History is not the past. It is the present. We carry our history with us. We are our history," wrote James Baldwin in a world that branded his Blackness as inhuman.

TITLE: How Morocco's unlikely World Cup success unified Arabs
SUMMARY: They're known as The Atlas Lions, the Moroccan football team that's ripped up the history books at the FIFA World Cup. Their run has upended all expectations, advancing deep into uncharted territory, further than they or any other African team has ever managed before.

TITLE: Russian defector says there are 'maniacs' in his former unit
SUMMARY: • EXCLUSIVE: US to send Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine

TITLE: Beijing streets left empty as Covid cases explode
SUMMARY: • Why people in China are panic buying canned yellow peaches as Covid surges

TITLE: William and Kate release summery family photo for official Christmas card
SUMMARY: The UK may have been blanketed with snow this week, but you wouldn't know it from the image on the Prince and Princess of Wales' official Christmas card.

TITLE: Massive storm spreads blizzard across Northern Plains, bringing fierce snow and dangerous travel conditions
SUMMARY: The deadly storm system plowing east across virtually the entire United States is far from over, threatening more tornadoes, freezing rain, treacherous travel and power outages.

TITLE: 'When Harry Met Sally,' 'Iron Man' and 'Superfly' added to National Film Registry
SUMMARY: This annual list of 25 influential films to be inducted into the National Film Registry of the Library of Congress has been revealed.

TITLE: The world's top city destinations for 2022 are revealed
SUMMARY: Europe has been winning the tourism game in 2022, says a new report by a UK-based market research company called -- no bias intended -- Euromonitor.

TITLE: Why a growing number of states are cracking down on TikTok
SUMMARY: Two years after TikTok avoided a national ban in the United States, the popular short-form video app is now facing growing pushback at the state level.

TITLE: 2 police officers shot and killed in Mississippi
Nearly half of US states lack data on incarcerated mothers, new report finds. Here's why that's 'very troubling'
SUMMARY: Nearly half of US states do not collect data on the number of incarcerated women with children making it difficult for some nonprofits to provide services to those youth, according to a new report released Wednesday.

TITLE: Hear intercepted call said to be between Russian soldiers on freezing front lines
SUMMARY: The Defense Intelligence of Ukraine has released audio of what they say is an intercepted call between Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine that paint a picture of the conditions they are fighting in. CNN has not been able to verify the audio.

TITLE: They were living ordinary and full lives in their small New England town. Then on December 14, 2012, everything changed
SUMMARY: They were living ordinary and full lives in the small New England town of Newtown, Connecticut, unprepared for the devastation that would unfold and occupy the rest of their days.

TITLE: McCarthy's impossible GOP math
SUMMARY: Political leaders are generally at their strongest the moment they take office.

TITLE: GOP strategist: McCarthy 'all wrong' in quest to be speaker
SUMMARY: Republican strategist Rina Shah says House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy is facing difficulties in his pursuit of becoming the next House speaker.

TITLE: There is a spending outline in Congress. Now what?
SUMMARY: Tuesday night's announcement that Senate and House negotiators secured an agreement on the omnibus spending bill framework is a big deal. With just a few legislative days to go before Christmas, aides and members were growing nervous that Congress was walking right up to the point of no return where there simply wasn't going to be enough time to pull this together before December 23.

TITLE: Biden signs into law same-sex marriage bill, 10 years after his famous Sunday show answer on the issue
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed into law Tuesday landmark new federal protections for same-sex and interracial couples, capping both a personal and national evolution on an issue that's enjoyed growing acceptance over the past decade.

TITLE: Justice Department has tried to access GOP Rep. Scott Perry's text messages
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has tried to gain access to Republican Rep. Scott Perry's text messages as part of a criminal investigation into 2020 election interference, facing off with his lawyers in a secret court proceeding after seizing his phone, CNN observed at the courthouse and sources familiar with the investigation said.

TITLE: Italian castle, palace and village on sale for $2 million
SUMMARY: Ever dreamed of owning your own secret citadel in a beautiful region of Italy, wandering along its fortified walls like a monarch surveying their kingdom?

TITLE: 2022: The year in pictures
Awe-inspiring photos of the world's most remarkable football pitches
SUMMARY: British journalist Ryan Herman still remembers the first football ground he ever visited as a kid in 1978 — the sights, the sounds and yes, the score.

TITLE: Cows herd suspect into police custody
SUMMARY: Cows herd suspect and police milk the chase video. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on how cows put a suspect out to pasture.

TITLE: Bernard Arnault just became the world's richest person. So who is he?
SUMMARY: Bernard Arnault, the chairman of French luxury goods giant LVMH, has just become the first European to top Bloomberg's list of the world's richest people, relegating Elon Musk to second place.

TITLE: What to expect from the Fed meeting
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates by half a point at the conclusion of its two-day policy meeting on Wednesday, an indication that the central bank is pulling back on its aggressive stance as signs begin to emerge that inflation may be easing.

TITLE: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' rekindles the wonder in a way that demands to be seen
SUMMARY: "Avatar" took a very basic story and adorned it with eye-popping spectacle, in a way that made the film a must-see commodity, and a record-breaking hit in the process. Thirteen years later, braving much different theatrical tides, director James Cameron has done it again with "Avatar: The Way of Water," a state-of-the-art exercise that rekindles that sense of wonder and demands to be seen by anyone with lingering interest in watching movies in theaters.
